intro: Silene brevicalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Silene brevicalyx blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
